intro: Sida commixta, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Sida commixta typically grows in moist, open habitats such as fields and along stream banks. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and hardy nature.
